posts.author: Jack Bauer
posts.content:
So, having played on Arelith for awhile and gaining some experience in game. I began to wonder why people do not ever consider longbow weapon master. Other than how it lacks AB compared to the arcane archer it seems to have a couple advantages. Higher crit range on longbow, possibility of 4x crits. Possibility to combo it with a melee weapon master for tons of hit points and melee capabilities with the ability to just swap to a rapier shield. With fighter levels it might even be possible to be a Fighter / Blackguard / Weaponmaster. 

Is it possible to do this? Weapon Master Archer? Or am I overlooking something involved here? Or is the way I went about it all wrong and I am using the wrong classes to achieve my goals? I am not sure, I would really value the insight of the pros on this one.

posts.author: Maximillian Kane
posts.content:
Hey man!

Yeah, you are! Weapon of Choice can only apply to a melee weapon. Doesn't work on Ranged or even Unarmed attacks :D

That said, there's a build in the old forums called the Devastating Specialist of Blade and Bow, who goes for DevCrit in a melee weapon and a bow!

posts.author: hunearo
posts.content: Wow Hip, I like this build very much :O if I were to build something with equally good melee and ranged AB, I would do it with a fighter/cot/something dex-er, but it can't get dev crit. Maybe something with RDD levels to boost up str, but it is just too simple (or not). I like the idea to boost str for melee, while you get the ranged AB from AA levels, and not DEX. Well, I made some RDD/AA builds in CBC with astronomical ranged AB and dev crit, but they don't have enough feats to manage a melee weapon... at best they can get a weapon finesse, but that's all.

posts.author: HipRedux
posts.content:
Yah, it's Mick-tastic!  This one solves the one problem I have with most DevCrit archer builds... 3 throw-away feats (PA/Cleave/GrtCleave), like some of the WM prereqs. Wasting that many feats is very painful to observe.  Dual focus at least puts the investment to good use. 

I'd say STR 30 is about as high as you'd want in a dedicated archer type (like the RDD/AA genre) since there are no Mighty bows I've ever seen over +10.
